definition: to run the meter (in a taxi)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: No, that's far too much. Your taxi has a meter.
sentences.chinese: 不，太贵了，你车上有表，打表吧。

sentences.english: Most taxis aren't metered, so make sure you organise the price beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的出租车不打表，需提前跟司机确定价格。

definition: to refuse to take a passenger (of taxi)
person who joins with others to reduce costs (carpooling, group buying, sharing an apartment etc)
to take a taxi (in town)/to hitch a lift
unlicensed or unofficial taxi/unlicensed motor vehicle
motorcycle taxi/abbr. for 摩托車的士|摩托车的士[mo2 tuo1 che1 di1 shi4]
to solicit (guests, clients, passengers etc)/to importune
